subject: Re: [junit] Classspath for ClassLoader
msgSnippet: ... I m just (re)learning Java and learning JUnit, so take this with a grain of salt... I had a similar problem, where I could not run my class from the GUI. I
messageBody:
G Ramasubramani wrote: 
However, in case I invoke it throught the GUI,
  
     >java junit.swingui.TestRunner A
  
     then an error is thrown. It appears to be a ClassLoader issue as the error thrown is a
 ClassCastException. 


I'm just (re)learning Java and learning JUnit, so take this with a grain of salt...

I had a similar problem, where I could not run my class from the GUI. I was
getting an error from the class loader (not sure if it is the same). Someone on
this list indicated that, because I was using a "package" I had to include the
package in the invocation. So I had to do something like:

java junit.swingui.TestRunner mypackagename.A

You may want to try this, if it applies and please let us know how it works.
Otherwise, maybe someone more experienced can give you a definitive
answer instead of a feeble guess :^)
